TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IWindowProvider

Docs.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that provide fundamental window-based functionality within a traditional [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].

remarks.format: ## Remarks Implemented on a UI Automation provider that must support the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.WindowPattern> control pattern.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed

remarks.format:
## Remarks Close must return immediately without blocking.
Close raises the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.WindowPatternIdentifiers.WindowClosedEvent> event. If possible, the event should be raised after the control has completed its associated action.
When called on a split pane control, this method will close the pane and remove the associated split. This method might also close all other panes, depending on implementation.

Docs.exception: When the control is unable to perform the requested action.
When the target element is no longer available (for example, the window has closed).

Docs.summary: Gets the interaction state of the window.
Gets a value that specifies whether the window is modal.
Docs.value: if the window is modal; otherwise .

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the window is the topmost element in the z-order.
Docs.value: if the window is topmost; otherwise .

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the window can be maximized.
Docs.value: if the window can be maximized; otherwise .

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the window can be minimized.
Docs.value: if the window can be minimized; otherwise .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetVisualState(valuetype System.Windows.Automation.WindowVisualState state) cil managed

Docs.param: The requested visual state of the window.
Docs.summary: Changes the visual state of the window. For example, minimizes or maximizes it.
Docs.exception: When the control does not support the requested behavior.

Docs.summary: Gets the visual state of the window.
Docs.value: The visual state of the window.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool WaitForInputIdle(int32 milliseconds) cil managed

Docs.param: The amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait for the associated process to become idle. The maximum is <xref:System.Int32>.
Docs.summary: Causes the calling code to block for the specified time or until the associated process enters an idle state, whichever completes first.
Docs.returns: if the window has entered the idle state; if the timeout occurred.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is typically used in conjunction with the handling of a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.WindowPatternIdentifiers.WindowOpenedEvent>.
The implementation is dependent on the underlying application framework; therefore this method might return some time after the window is ready for user input. The calling code should not rely on this method to ascertain exactly when the window has become idle.

Docs.exception: When the parameter passed in is not a valid number.
